sourceMeaningMnemonic: In your <radical>fingers</radical> are <radical>flowers</radical> which really <radical>suit</radical> you. But you throw them to the people waving to you from below, as you <kanji>board</kanji> your ship. The flowers fall, unneeded. You're <kanji>embark</kanji>ing on a new life, a new journey. There will be more flowers where you're going.
meaningInfo: Picture yourself boarding the ship and letting the flowers slip from your fingers, into the crowd of people waving goodbye.
readingMnemonic: You <kanji>board</kanji> a ship to <ja><reading>とう</reading>きょう</ja>, bound for your new life, of course!
readingInfo: Where else would you go at this point? I mean, come on. You've made it 53 levels since you embarked on your kanji journey with us. We know you by now. You want to be in <ja>とうきょう</ja>.
